questions.question: Which UNESCO site in Saudi Arabia is known for its rock-cut tombs and was once an ancient Nabataean city, second only to Petra?
questions.context: This site, inscribed on the World Heritage list in 2008, reveals the wealth and culture of the Nabataeans, who thrived around the 1st century AD.

questions.question: Which historical battle site is located in Belgium and gave its name to a famous defeat of Napoleon in 1815?
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars, and its name has become synonymous with a significant defeat.

questions.question: What is the iconic museum in France, originally a royal palace, that houses the famous painting of the Mona Lisa?
questions.context: This world-renowned museum, with a glass pyramid entrance, is one of the largest and most visited in the world.

questions.question: In India, what modern architectural wonder, completed in 2004, serves as the headquarters for the Bahá'í Faith and resembles a giant lotus flower?
questions.context: The structure welcomes people of all religions and has won numerous architectural awards for its design.

questions.question: Which space exploration site in Kazakhstan has been pivotal in launching many historic space missions since 1955?
questions.context: Yuri Gagarin began his historic space journey from here in 1961, marking the first human flight into cosmic space.
